attack_paths.justification: This attack path exploits the Apache Tomcat service running on port 8080, which is publicly accessible. The presence of the CVE-2021-4104 vulnerability allows for remote code execution, enabling an attacker to gain initial access. Following this, the attacker can exploit the MySQL privilege escalation vulnerability (CVE-2019-1234) on the db-master, which is reachable from the app-server-01, allowing for further escalation and access to sensitive data.

mitre_chain.description: The attacker exploits the CVE-2021-4104 vulnerability in Apache Tomcat on port 8080 to execute arbitrary code, gaining access to the app-server-01.
mitre_chain.defensive_context: To prevent this, ensure that Apache Tomcat is updated to the latest version to mitigate known vulnerabilities.
mitre_chain.detection_ideas: Monitor for unusual requests or payloads targeting the Tomcat service, especially those indicative of RCE attempts.

mitre_chain.description: After gaining access to app-server-01, the attacker connects to the db-master on port 3306 and exploits the CVE-2019-1234 vulnerability in MySQL to escalate privileges.
mitre_chain.defensive_context: Apply the latest patches to MySQL to fix known privilege escalation vulnerabilities.
mitre_chain.detection_ideas: Implement logging and monitoring for MySQL access patterns, especially for privilege changes or unusual queries.
